page.title: 16EDUCATION IN CHITTERNE
page.content: People in Chitterne were sorry to see the village school close in 1969 but there were insufficient children to keep it open. Primary school children now go to school in Codford or Tilshead, whilst those of secondary age go to Warminster or Market Lavington. Colleges of Further Education are situated in Salisbury and Trowbridge. The Education Authority provides transport to Codford and Warminster. Tilshead school has its own mini-bus which collects children from Chitterne, and parents take to Lavington by private car. Travel grants are provided for those attending the Colleges. The school bus leaves for Warminster at 7.50 a.m. whilst those going to Colleges have to be in Codford by 7.30 a.m. to catch the service buses.
